conbody.p: The hierarchical organization of a menu is presented in the menu editor by a tree. Each tree node is a parent menu with submenu items. Submenu item can also be a parent. Each leaf of this tree must be associated with a pageflow that is triggered when the end-user clicks the entry in the runtime application. A parent menu item may or may not have a linked pageflow. If not, the first child found in the menu tree with available pageflow is launched.

The first level corresponds to the activity menu entry and is displayed in the primary navigation bar. All other menu items designed in the menu model become a menu cascade in a secondary navigation bar. The tree depth is limited to six levels.
